intro: Hieracium eriocephalum, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and hairy stems, which give it its common name. The plant produces showy yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in moist, open habitats such as meadows and stream sides. Hieracium eriocephalum is often found in temperate regions of Europe and is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes.
